born Berlin, Jan 11, 1872; died Salzburg, Nov 13, 1944

div.p: Trained at the Veit Conservatory, Graener held conducting positions in Germany and England, then in 1908 joined the Neues Wiener Konservatorium. He was made a professor of the Berlin Akademie der K체nste in 1920 and succeeded Reger at the Leipzig Conservatory. He was Director of the Berlin Stern'sches Conservatorium 1930-33, where he also took masterclasses. A member of the National Socialist Kampfbund f체r Deutsche Kultur, he became vice-president of the Reichsmusikkammer 1933-41.
